text:
A heartfelt condolence! Avengers super fan, Emilio Pachon, 11, has died on Wednesday, March 28, Fox News journalist Shannon Bream has confirmed.

In his last days, Shannon tweeted that the young boy dying wish was to hear from one of the Avengers before he died. This resulted in a deep love and support from the hit series' superheroes the child admired.

Among the many Marvel actors who reached out were Chris Evans, Jeremy Renner and Ryan Reynoldsand, who offered to speak to the 11-year-old boy who suffered from Neurofibromatosis type I.

The 47-year-old news reporter said that the well-wishes the boy received from the superheroes "lit up his hospital room and blessed his family."

Prior to Emilio's death, Chloe Bennet also reached out and asked for the little boy's name in addition to Zachary Levi offer to help the Emilio. Paul Bettany reached out the boy as well.

Since his passing, Zachary and CNN host Jake Tapper expressed their condolences to the family via social media.

Check them out.

Thank you, Shannon, for spearheading this, and for giving us the honor of being even a small moment in Emilio’s short life. I will continue to lift up his family in prayer. ?? https://t.co/feCDED0BIs — Zachary Levi (@ZacharyLevi) March 28, 2018

What a special little boy and a special family. Thanks to @ShannonBream for bringing attention to them and to all the Avengers — Paul Rudd, @ChrisEvans and more — who helped make his last moments happy ones. — Jake Tapper (@jaketapper) March 28, 2018

Shannon told her followers,
title: Avengers Young Fan, Emilio Pachon, 11, Dies After Chris Evans and More Fulfill His Last Wish
